New Records: Shohei Ohtani broke his career-high of 103 runs in a season with 104 runs
Ohtani is pursuing the record of being the first major leaguer in history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season
Key Match Events: Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the third inning
Mookie Betts had a RBI single in the third inning
Pre-Game Insights: The article does not contain any pre-game insights
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts, the Dodgers manager, commented on Ohtani's performance, saying 'Any big moment he seems to rise to the occasion'
Ohtani expressed his thoughts on the game, saying 'We collectively did very well against him'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy handled the ceremonial first pitch
Others: Walker Buehler allowed four runs — two earned — and five hits in 4 2/3 innings
Cade Povich and Bobby Miller are the starting pitchers for the next games for the Orioles and Dodgers respectively
